words.definition: To go across something is to go to the other side of it.
words.example: He walked across the bridge.

words.definition: To breathe is to let air go in and out of your body.
words.example: We need oxygen to breathe.

words.definition: A characteristic is something that shows what a person or thing is like.
words.example: One characteristic of a tiger is its stripes.

words.definition: To consume is to eat or drink something.
words.example: Jack consumed a large meal.

words.definition: To excite is to make someone feel happy and interested.
words.example: The news excited him.

words.definition: If something is extreme, it is very large or severe.
words.example: The weather was extreme.

words.definition: Fear is the feeling of being afraid.
words.example: I have a fear of heights.

words.definition: If you are fortunate, you are lucky.
words.example: I was fortunate to win the lottery.

words.definition: To happen is to take place.
words.example: What happened to your arm?

words.definition: The length of something is how long it is.
words.example: What is the length of the table?

words.definition: A mistake is something you do wrong.
words.example: I made a mistake on my test.

words.definition: To observe is to watch something carefully.
words.example: I observed the birds.

words.definition: An opportunity is a chance to do something.
words.example: I had an opportunity to go to China.

words.definition: A prize is something you win.
words.example: He won first prize in the race.

words.definition: A race is a contest to see who is fastest.
words.example: He ran in a race.

words.definition: To realize is to suddenly understand something.
words.example: I realized I forgot my keys.

words.definition: To respond is to answer.
words.example: He didn't respond to my question.

words.definition: A risk is a chance of something bad happening.
words.example: There is a risk of rain.

words.definition: To wonder is to ask yourself questions about something.
words.example: I wonder why he is late.

words.definition: Yet is used to say something has not happened up to now.
words.example: I haven't eaten lunch yet.
